description:
"One day, we`re going to make the strongest battery ever!" Based on the promise to reunite with http://anidb.net/ch94946 [Hikaru] again, http://anidb.net/ch94945 [Daigo] has moved on to Fuurin Academy Middle School. Daigo is the captain for the baseball club, but with all the older students gone, the team is all girls, including http://anidb.net/ch94947 [Mutsuko]. With a group of peculiar newcomers, the new Fuurin Academy baseball club is off to a new start!
Source: crunchyroll

REGULAR.description:
Our main character Shigeno Daigo is a 2nd year student in middle school, whose father is a pro baseball player who went as far as playing in the Major League. Daigo goes to Fuurin Academy with his childhood friend Sakura Mutsuko, who was also his teammate on the little league baseball team. While both of them are on the baseball team, they only have 6 members in total, of which 4 are girls. Just then, at the admission ceremony, a bunch of 1st years with sports scholarships gathered and...
Source: crunchyroll

The Fuurin baseball team just had 6 members, but with the addition of the Nishina and four other 1st years hailing from the famous Nanyou Lions, the upperclassmen redouble their focus and go to the field for morning practice. However, those 1st years declare that they have no intention of joining practice until their mentor from their Nanyou days, coach Kunitomo, finalizes his transfer to be the coach of the Fuurin baseball team. That`s when their advior, Yamaguchi-sensei tells Daigo she needs to talk about something...
Source: crunchyroll

titles.title: That Catcher`s Got a Sharp Tongue
そのキャッチャー, 辛口につき

REGULAR.description:
Since the transfer of the new coach fell through, four of the 1st year boys decide to move on to the senior league. That means there are only three new members for the Fuurin baseball team, one boy, Nishina, and two girls from the famous Yokohama Little team, Anita and Chisato. They just managed to scrape together 9 members when they find out that their first public tournament is only two weeks away. Excited about the real matches coming up, catcher Anita immediately lays into Daigo that Mutsuko and Nishina as pitchers are not sufficient.
Source: crunchyroll

The morning of the first tournament match for the Fuurin Middle School Baseball team,
Daigo`s father Goro talks to his eternal friend, former teammate, and Daigo`s coach in his grade school days, Satou Toshiya.
While updating each other, Toshiya brings the conversation to the upcoming Fuurin match.
Goro confidently tells Toshiya that "Daigo can do it", based on Daigo`s amazing commitment the past half year,
after unexpectedly becoming captain of the team as a first-year.
Source: crunchyroll

The first opponent for Fuurin`s new baseball team is going to be Itsuki Middle School. Itsuki`s ace Yokouchi is surprised to see that Fuurin just has 9 players, of which 6 are girls. While complaining why he as the ace pitcher has to start against a team full of girls, Yokouchi faces off with Fuurin`s top batter, Chisato. After the switch, Mutsuko`s starting pitcher focuses and heads for the mound in her very first official game, but then...
Source: crunchyroll

Luckily, Fuurin was able to pull ahead with three runs in the first inning of their first regional preliminaries game. However, Itsuki`s Yokouchi begins to mix in sliders that he had kept hidden up his sleeve until then, causing one batter after the other to strike out. Mutsuko combines accuracy and breaking balls to keep the Itsuki batters under control as well. Daigo prepares for a low score, close quarter game, and worries that the Fuurin defense might start to crack. Shortly after that, the 3rd-year Tanba on first base makes an unbelievable mistake.
Source: crunchyroll

The next opponent for Fuurin`s baseball team is going to be Seiwa, Daigo and Sakura`s old Little League teammates Urabe and Andy now play. After seeing Seiwa steal 11 bases in their first match and seeing that match be called, both Anita and Daigo are made painfully aware that they need to do something to combat Seiwa`s mobility and base stealing prowess. That`s why Daigo calls the team to school even though they just finished a match, in order to allow their pitcher Mutsuko train so she can deal with the enemy runners.
Source: crunchyroll

In order to not allow Seiwa to utilize their frightening mobility with base steals and bunt, Daigo and team do drills to teach their pitcher Mutsuko how to do pick-off attempts of runners.
The next day, after having done their due diligence, Daigo and team go into their second game. Even though Daigo predicted that Seiwa would not recklessly attack from the beginning, Seiwa`s top batter suddenly leaves the base. They immediately try to shake Fuurin`s battery. While catcher Anita fiercely tries to get Mutsuko back into shape, eventually even she loses her cool...
Source: crunchyroll

In the second match of the district preliminaries, Anita is too focused on being cautious of Seiwa Middle`s mobility and loses sight of everything else.
Even from right field, Nishina saw this and points out her missteps so accurately that Anita can`t retort.
She had painful memories about the catcher position from her time at the prestigious Yokohama Littles as well.
Concerned that she`s a failure as a catcher, and down on herself despite the game still going on, she asks Daigo to take over catching.
Source: crunchyroll

Fuurin Middle managed to catch up thanks to Anita`s hit, but in the top of the 6th inning, they let Seiwa all but secure their win with a long hit.
To make matters worse, catcher Anita injures her wrist during a close play.
Thus Daigo will switch from left field to catcher.
In the dangerous situation of having 1st and 3rd bases loaded, up to bat for Seiwa is their #4, Andy.
Up against their old teammate with the mighty swing, what is Daigo and Mutsuko`s strategy?!
Source: crunchyroll

The 2nd match of the district preliminaries is finally entering the final inning!
In the top of the 7th inning, Fuurin Middle allows Seiwa Middle to widen the gap further by scoring another run.
However, thanks to Nishina, who was suddenly put onto the mound, Fuurin narrowly makes it through this tight spot.
However, their #4 Anita had just hurt her wrist...
Seiwa`s battery, Urabe and Andy, keep pitching inside to attack her weak spot.
Source: crunchyroll

With Daigo`s epic game ending hit, Fuurin Middle defeats the formidable opponent Seiwa Middle, where Daigo`s old friends Urabe and Andy play.
They are now moving on to the semi-finals of the district tournament.
Despite being tired from the intense game, the Fuurin players watch another school`s game, however Tao and Yayoi sneak away after the game.
Anita had looked up to Tao and Yayoi as her senpais since their time at Yokohama Littles, so their behavior deeply concerns her while she goes to have her injury checked out.
Source: crunchyroll

Even though the heavy rain from the day before had barely stopped, Fuurin Middle has to play in the semifinals against Yanagawa Middle.
As she was injured, Anita is moved down to 6th batter, with Daigo being 4th and Nishina 5th.
Starting pitcher for the team of 9 is Mutsuko again, which catches her by surprise, as she expected to swapped out for Chisato.
However, Daigo earnestly tells her how impressed he is by her growth.
Source: crunchyroll

Thanks to Kandori`s incredible grand slam, Fuurin Middle win the semifinals and hastily begin to make preparations for the finals in the afternoon. Daigo helps Nishina with pitching practice as he`s the starting pitcher for the finals, while Mutsuko and the others observe the Eihou Academy vs Oobi Middle School game. However, Eihou and Oobi`s game takes an unexpected turn and after Daigo is rushed to the stands, a face he sees amidst Oobi Middle`s line up rattles him...
Source: crunchyroll

Fuurin Middle has fought their way to the district tournament finals with just 9 players, and finally faces off against Oobi Middle, where a bunch of ex Yokohama Senior players are.
When Daigo sees the two left-handed players, Mayumura Michiru on short stop, and Idemitsu on second, combined with their starting pitcher Seto and catcher Uozumi, he realizes what Oobi Middle`s strategy with their center line is. Then, when Fuurin`s top batter Chisato knocks a ball to Michiru on short stop, but then...
Source: crunchyroll

It`s the finals against Oobi Middle with Mayumura Michiru and three other formidable players. As Fuurin`s starting pitcher Nishina pitches with all his might from the beginning, he runs out of stamina and coupled with defense bloopers, they lose 5 runs in the bottom of the third inning. Instead of letting Nishina continue, Chisato from center field takes over in the 4th inning. Though she has some experience from her time at Yokohama Littles, this is the first time in middle school. Her father is over-excited in the stands, but what kind of pitching performance will Chisato give?!
Source: crunchyroll

Chisato`s timely hit in the top of the 5th inning finally allows Fuurin to break free from their no-hit spell and get two runs in against Oobi`s second pitcher Idemitsu. However, Oobi then puts Mayumura in as a reliever and she ends the offense after Tao hits a grounder to shortstop. While Chisato had shown surprisingly nice pitching after starting in the 4th inning, she`s out of energy and has no grip strength left for another inning. Due to inning restrictions, Mutsuko can`t get up on the mound, but then who will pitch?
Source: crunchyroll

While Yayoi, emergency reliever taking over for Chisato, is able to subdue the Oobi batters, Fuurin`s counter-offense is also shut down.
The game goes into the final inning with Oobi Middle leading with three runs.
In the all or nothing top of the 7th inning, Fuurin has a real chance with two outs, but first and third loaded!
Top batter Chisato toughs it out until four balls, turning up the pressure on Oobi with two outs and fully loaded bases.
Then, it`s Tao`s turn, who had been shut down too easily in the previous inning.
Source: crunchyroll

Fuurin makes a phenomenal comeback and an upset, but then Yayoi has to face off against Oobi`s strongest batters!
Then, the final match between Daigo`s Fuurin Middle and Oobi Middle comes to a close.
After this intense finale, Daigo gets home, both physically and mentally drained.
Even though it seems that Daigo might not be able to keep going, a piece of paper on his desk changes everything.
It was a letter from his father, who had watched over their dramatic fight against Oobi Middle.
Source: crunchyroll

With the summer tournament behind them, the Fuurin baseball team has to face fall without their oldest player, Tanba, and have to rebuild the team. But as they now only have 8 players, Tanba agrees to help out so the practice match on the weekend can take place. Needing a more permanent solution, Daigo and the others discuss who of the existing student body they could recruit. That`s when Chisato reveals that she has a potential lead...
Source: crunchyroll

Fuurin Middle is still struggling with their roster. Though Daigo approaches Chisato`s older sister, he completely gets shut down. Somehow they get their ninth player by adding the short stop player Chiba to the team. Still, Anita and Chisato have not given up on getting Chiyo to join the team. When Nishina finds a letter from Anita in his locker, asking him to meet her before practice, he gets his hopes up for something...
Source: crunchyroll

Fuurin Middle got their wish of having a practice match against the elite team of Tsujidou Academy, but had to put their manager Chiyo into their lineup for the hospitalized Chiba.
Seeing that they have seven girls, they are assigned a 10 run handicap, which irritates even Daigo. In order to get Tsujidou back for that, Yayoi and Tao make good defensive plays and at bat, Daigo and Anita whittle down the opposing pitcher, Oka.
Source: crunchyroll

Next to Anita`s homerun, Chiyo also gets a hit in on her first day, allowing Fuurin to widen the lead against Tsujidou Middle.
However, when Tsujidou`s second pitcher gets on the mound, his ultra-fast balls and wildly curving "Mario Balls" dampen their mood.
As the starting pitcher, Mutsuko aims to hold their lead and have the game be called for them, but in the bottom of the third inning, Mario`s double sets Tsujidou up for an attack.
On top of that, a ball flies over to the left field, where Chiyo is defending...
Source: crunchyroll

Even though Fuurin Middle has a huge lead against Tsujidou Middle, once their real A-team comes into play, the lead all but evaporates. On top of that, when Sakaguchi Hikaru (Satou Hikaru), Daigo`s and Mutsuko`s teammate from their grade school days, comes onto the field as Tsujidou`s catcher, Daigo is visibly shaken. Hikaru tells him that he`s looking to become a Major League catcher, just like his father Tsohiya. How good has Hikaru become?
Source: crunchyroll

The Fuurin baseball team suffered a humiliating defeat by Tsujidou Middle.
It seems like Tao and Yayoi are done after having the boys` superiority thrust in their faces.
Nishina and Anita train even harder, vowing to get revenge.
Mutsuko`s confidence as a pitcher has been crushed.
And it seems Daigo has lost his passion after being ridiculed by Hikaru.
While Kandori and Chiyo can only watch their teammates flounder, Chisato is still her quirky self.
Is there something that could reunite the nine Fuurin souls?
Source: crunchyroll
